description: From Anglo-Norman somoundre, from Old French sumundre, from Latin summonēre, itself from sub + monēre, ultimately from Proto-Indo-European *monéyeti, causative from *men- (“to think”).

entries.meaning: (video games) A creature magically summoned to do the summoner's bidding.

examples: The deceased was 58 years of age, was the picture of health even five or six hours prior to his death, when suddenly the grim messenger came with a summon from a Higher Tribunal, calling him to duties above.

verbs.description: summon (third-person singular simple present summons, present participle summoning, simple past and past participle summoned)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To call people together; to convene.
examples: Silence is primary, summoning presence to itself; so it's a connection to the realm of origin.

entries.meaning: (transitive) To ask someone to come; to send for.
(transitive) To rouse oneself to exert a skill.
examples: Synonyms: summon up, muster, muster up

entries.meaning: (fantasy, transitive) To call a resource by magic.

description: Borrowed from Malay saman (“fine, financial penalty”), which is itself borrowed from English summons (“notice summoning someone to appear in court”). This sense re-emerged in English as summon likely due to the erroneous belief that the original singular English word summons is plural. Doublet of summons and saman.

entries.meaning: (Malaysia, colloquial, slang) A fine; a fee or monetary penalty incurred for breaking the law; usually for a minor offence such as a traffic violation.
examples: You better pay off the parking summon tomorrow before you kena interest on it.

entries.meaning: (Malaysia, colloquial, slang) A notice of an infringement of the law, usually incurring such a penalty; a citation or ticket.

verbs.description: summon (third-person singular simple present summons, present participle (rare) summoning, simple past and past participle summoned)

entries.meaning: (transitive, Malaysia, colloquial, slang) To impose such a fine or penalty, or to issue a notice thereof.
examples: The police summoned the driver for speeding.
